channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Claudette Colvin, who refused to move seats on a bus at start of civil rights movement, dies
item.description: Civil rights pioneer Claudette Colvin has died. She was 86. Her 1955 arrest for refusing to give up her seat on a segregated Montgomery bus helped spark the modern civil rights movement.
item.content:encoded:
Civil rights pioneer Claudette Colvin has died. She was 86. Her 1955 arrest for refusing to give up her seat on a segregated Montgomery bus helped spark the modern civil rights movement.

(Image credit: Julie Jacobson)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Wyoming is among the states that could cut property taxes used for local services
item.description: Wyoming lawmakers are in the front of a national trend of cutting or eliminating property taxes. But they face a challenge from activists seeking to save money for police, firefighters and libraries.
item.content:encoded: Wyoming lawmakers are in the front of a national trend of cutting or eliminating property taxes. But they face a challenge from activists seeking to save money for police, firefighters and libraries.
item.dc:creator: Chris Clements

item.title: Supreme Court appears likely to uphold state bans on transgender athletes
item.description: To date, 27 states have enacted laws barring transgender participation in sports.
item.content:encoded:
To date, 27 states have enacted laws barring transgender participation in sports.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Scott Adams, the controversial cartoonist behind 'Dilbert,' dies at 68
item.description: Adams announced in May that he was dying of metastatic prostate cancer. Thousands of newspapers carried his strip satirizing office culture from the '90s until a controversy in 2023.
item.content:encoded:
Adams announced in May that he was dying of metastatic prostate cancer. Thousands of newspapers carried his strip satirizing office culture from the '90s until a controversy in 2023.

(Image credit: Lea Suzuki)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: California fire victims say fighting with insurance companies has delayed rebuilding
item.description: Wildfires last January destroyed communities around Los Angeles. Homeowners say recovery has been slowed by fights with insurers to get their claims paid.
item.content:encoded:
Wildfires last January destroyed communities around Los Angeles. Homeowners say recovery has been slowed by fights with insurers to get their claims paid.

(Image credit: Josh Edelson)
item.dc:creator: Michael Copley

item.title: A conservative Supreme Court tackles the question of trans women in school sports
item.description: The first case involves an Idaho student barred by state law from trying out for the track team; the second was brought by a West Virginia middle schooler barred by state law from competing.
item.content:encoded:
The first case involves an Idaho student barred by state law from trying out for the track team; the second was brought by a West Virginia middle schooler barred by state law from competing.

(Image credit: Jose Luis Magana)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Trump administration to shutter an immigration court, adding to judges' backlog
item.description: The planned closure of the San Francisco Immigration Court comes as immigration judges spent the last year facing pressure to move through their caseloads faster and streamline deportations.
item.content:encoded:
The planned closure of the San Francisco Immigration Court comes as immigration judges spent the last year facing pressure to move through their caseloads faster and streamline deportations.

(Image credit: Eric Risberg)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Trump continues to threaten military action against Iran amid deadly protest crackdown, Minnesota officials file lawsuit over ICE tactics, SCOTUS to hear cases on trans women in public school sports.
item.content:encoded: Trump continues to threaten military action against Iran amid deadly protest crackdown, Minnesota officials file lawsuit over ICE tactics, SCOTUS to hear cases on trans women in public school sports.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: 250 years of U.S. history was projected on the Washington Monument. A lot was missing
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep explores the Trump administration's portrayal of 250 years of U.S history captured on the Washington Monument.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep explores the Trump administration's portrayal of 250 years of U.S history captured on the Washington Monument.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Thousands of New York City nurses strike for second day
item.description: Fifteen thousand nurses are striking in New York City for a second day, seeking better pay and protection from workplace violence, among other concessions.
item.content:encoded: Fifteen thousand nurses are striking in New York City for a second day, seeking better pay and protection from workplace violence, among other concessions.
item.dc:creator: Caroline Lewis
